content.raw:
@{557058:684383ab-ac95-4859-a350-4a6f41a94a22} and I were discussing this issue. We "think" this strategy might work with the `enable_ros_network` solution in parallel:

1. Replace the `<node name="spawn_model" ...` call in our launch files with another call to a custom node.
2. This custom node reads the `robot_description` value from the ROS parameter server.
3. Then, calls the external command `gz model -s <string>`, where <string> is the value read in step \(2\). Note that this step requires gz transport to work but it should because we're inside the simulation container.
content.html:
@Shane Loretz and I were discussing this issue. We "think" this strategy might work with the enable_ros_network solution in parallel:

  1. Replace the <node name="spawn_model" ... call in our launch files with another call to a custom node.
  2. This custom node reads the robot_description value from the ROS parameter server.
  3. Then, calls the external command gz model -s <string>, where <string> is the value read in step (2). Note that this step requires gz transport to work but it should because we're inside the simulation container.

content.raw:
**How to Run**

_Terminal 1_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.zsh`

`export GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx` \(replace tylerlum with <username>\)

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch verbose:=true`

Manually delete wamv model \(click on boat, right click, delete\)

‌

_Terminal 2_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.zsh`

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_wamv.launch wamv_target:=$HOME/my_urdf.urdf`

`gz model --model-name=wamv --spawn-file=$HOME/my_urdf.urdf`

‌

WORKS. Model shows immediately!

At a high-level, the model being spawned is the wamv \(boat\), which described by a URDF file created before runtime. \(eg. $HOME/my\_urdf.urdf\).

The issue is that this urdf includes `.dae` files that it cannot find, unless I set `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH`. These both include models such as `[model://vrx_gazebo/models/3d_lidar/mesh/3d_lidar.dae]`, but also `.dae` files that are not currently models such as `[model://wamv_description/mesh/engine.dae]`.

From what you said, I believe setting `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH` to /home/tylerlum/vrx\_ws/src/vrx/vrx\_gazebo/models makes sense

```
vrx_gazebo/models
├── 3d_lidar
│   ├── mesh
│   │   ├── 3d_lidar.dae
│   │   └── 3d_lidar.png
│   ├── model.config
│   └── model.sdf
├── antenna
│   ├── meshes
│   │   ├── antenna.dae
│   │   └── antenna.png
│   ├── model.config
│   └── model.sdf
```

but setting it to /home/tylerlum/vrx\_ws/src/vrx/wamv\_description or /home/tylerlum/vrx\_ws/src/vrx/wamv\_description/mesh doesn’t

```
wamv_description
├── CHANGELOG.rst
├── CMakeLists.txt
├── mesh
│   ├── engine.dae
│   ├── propeller.dae
│   ├── WAM-V-Base.dae
│   └── WamV.png
├── package.xml
└── urdf
    ├── battery.xacro
    ├── cpu_cases.xacro
    ├── thrusters
    │   └── engine.xacro
    └── wamv_base.urdf.xacro
```

Is there a nice solution to this? Or would we have to restructure these wamv\_description/mesh/<name>.dae files to wamv\_description/models/<name>/mesh/<name>.dae? Like

```
wamv_description/models
├── engine
│   ├── mesh
│   │   ├── engine.dae
│   │   └── engine.png
│   ├── model.config
│   └── model.sdf
├── propeller
│   ├── meshes
│   │   ├── propeller.dae
│   │   └── propeller.png
│   ├── model.config
│   └── model.sdf
```

content.raw:
@{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} and I were discussing about this. All `package://` lines are converted into `model://` while parsing it by sdformat. That means, all is relative to the model directories specified by `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH`. I don’t think we have a clean solution here to avoid the errors. One “workaround” could be to do something like this:

```
wamv_description
|-- CHANGELOG.rst
|-- CMakeLists.txt
|-- mesh
|   |-- WAM-V-Base.dae
|   |-- WamV.png
|   |-- engine.dae
|   `-- propeller.dae
|-- package.xml
|-- urdf
|   |-- battery.xacro
|   |-- cpu_cases.xacro
|   |-- thrusters
|   |   `-- engine.xacro
|   `-- wamv_base.urdf.xacro
`-- wamv_description
    |-- mesh -> ../mesh/
    `-- model.config
```

and set the `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH` to the top level `wamv_description` directory. Essentially, a new subdirectory with the Gazebo model structure including a symbolic link to the `mesh` directory for avoiding extra copies of the meshes. I don't think we need the `model.sdf` file, just `model.config` is fine to avoid the errors.
content.html:
@Ian Chen and I were discussing about this. All package:// lines are converted into model:// while parsing it by sdformat. That means, all is relative to the model directories specified by GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH. I don’t think we have a clean solution here to avoid the errors. One “workaround” could be to do something like this:

wamv_description
|-- CHANGELOG.rst
|-- CMakeLists.txt
|-- mesh
|   |-- WAM-V-Base.dae
|   |-- WamV.png
|   |-- engine.dae
|   `-- propeller.dae
|-- package.xml
|-- urdf
|   |-- battery.xacro
|   |-- cpu_cases.xacro
|   |-- thrusters
|   |   `-- engine.xacro
|   `-- wamv_base.urdf.xacro
`-- wamv_description
    |-- mesh -> ../mesh/
    `-- model.config

and set the GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH to the top level wamv_description directory. Essentially, a new subdirectory with the Gazebo model structure including a symbolic link to the mesh directory for avoiding extra copies of the meshes. I don't think we need the model.sdf file, just model.config is fine to avoid the errors.

content.raw:
I’m starting to understand how this works. If the error is

```
[Wrn] [SystemPaths.cc:459] File or path does not exist [""] [model://vrx_gazebo/models/sensor_post/mesh/sensor_post_arm.dae]
```

  
It searches EXACTLY for `model://vrx_gazebo/models/sensor_post/mesh/sensor_post_arm.dae` relative to the model path. 

‌

If `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx`, it works \(finds the file\), as it can find the file at `/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx` \+ `/vrx_gazebo/models/sensor_post/mesh/sensor_post_arm.dae`. 

If `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/models`, it doesn’t work \(can’t find the file\), as it can find the file at `/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/models` \+ `/vrx_gazebo/models/sensor_post/mesh/sensor_post_arm.dae`, which is nonsense.

content.raw: Do you need the extra `vrx_gazebo/models/vrx_gazebo` directory? It seems that all content under `vrx_gazebo/models` are Gazebo models, no xacros or mesh files. I don’t see why you need the trick here.

content.raw:
Unfortunately, we do need it. The errors say the models in vrx\_gazebo are `[model://vrx_gazebo/models/battery/mesh/battery.dae]`. It looks for this relative to the model path.

If the model path is /home/tylerlum/vrx\_ws/src/vrx, it would find the file at /home/tylerlum/vrx\_ws/src/vrx \+ `/vrx_gazebo/models/battery/mesh/battery.dae`. The issue is that the directories in /home/tylerlum/vrx\_ws/src/vrx do not have model.config files.

If the model path is /home/tylerlum/vrx\_ws/src/vrx/vrx\_gazebo/models, it would find the file at /home/tylerlum/vrx\_ws/src/vrx/vrx\_gazebo/models \+ `/vrx_gazebo/models/battery/mesh/battery.dae`. The good thing is that all directories in /home/tylerlum/vrx\_ws/src/vrx/vrx\_gazebo/models have model.config files to avoid the issue.  We need the extra dirs to make it work /home/tylerlum/vrx\_ws/src/vrx/vrx\_gazebo/models \+ `/vrx_gazebo/models/battery/mesh/battery.da`

content.raw:
@{557058:4ded1ddf-947e-4154-bbd1-3dba24f1bdbd} This PR should be ready for review and merging unless you see any issues with it. 

**To Test:**

_Regression test 1_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch verbose:=true` should work normally

`rostopic echo /vrx/debug/wind/direction`, `rostopic echo /gazebo/model_states` these should both be published to

_Regression test 2_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch vrx_gazebo dock.launch verbose:=true` should work normally

`rostopic echo /vrx/debug/wind/direction`, `rostopic echo /gazebo/model_states` these should both be published to

_New Test 1_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash`  `roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_wamv.launch wamv_target:=$HOME/my_urdf.urdf`  `roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch verbose:=true non_competition_mode:=false urdf:=$HOME/my_urdf.urdf` should look the same as usual, maybe slight delay in model spawn

`rostopic echo /vrx/debug/wind/direction`, `rostopic echo /gazebo/model_states` these should both NOT be published to

_New Test 2_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.bash` `roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch verbose:=true non_competition_mode:=false` should look the same as usual, maybe slight delay in model spawn

`rostopic echo /vrx/debug/wind/direction`, `rostopic echo /gazebo/model_states` these should both NOT be published to

**Key Changes:**

1. Use `non_competition_mode` argument instead of `competition_mode` because would have to negate it for `enable_ros_network` and `VRX_DEBUG`. Using $\(eval not arg\('competition\_mode'\)\) did not work for VRX\_DEBUG, maybe this part compiles too late and is not recognized. Please let me know if we should change the name to `publish_non_competition_topics`, or even change it back to `competition_mode` \(and probably use if/unless in tags, but may be messier code\)
2. Change all instances of `package://vrx_gazebo/models/<model>...`  to `model://<model>...`, ensure this doesn’t break anything
3. Added comments for clarity
4. Tried to move `rosrun xacro...` before `wait_until_gzserver_is_up`, but it did not work. Not a big deal and works fine. 

Let me know if you have any concerns or issues.
